ygData.subject: RE: Binding Points
ygData.msgSnippet: Hail all, I heard some rumour that you can eventually be bound at the wizard gating points. Someone I grouped with once said he was once bound to the one in
ygData.messageBody:
Hail all,

I heard some rumour that you can eventually be bound at the wizard gating points. Someone I grouped with once said he was once bound to the one in Greater faydark(between the pillars) can anyone confirm if this is possible ?

/Njelm, shorty paladin with a heart of gold.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Paul Duquette [SMTP:PDuquette@...]
> Sent: den 10 augusti 1999 21:45
> To: eqpaladin@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqpaladin] Binding Points
>
> From: "Paul Duquette" <PDuquette@...>
>
> Silvermyst,
>
> All you can do is find the closest binding spot and offer to pay a caster to
> do it for you. I hate running back myself but if it bothered me that much
> I'd probley play a different class. =)
>
> Perry
> Tarew Marr
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: McConnell, Jeff <Jeff.McConnell@...>
> To: <eqpaladin@onelist.com>
> Sent: Tuesday, August 10, 1999 3:30 PM
> Subject: [eqpaladin] Binding Points
>
>
> > From: "McConnell, Jeff" <Jeff.McConnell@...>
> >
> >
> >
> > Hail
> > I am currently level 16 and I am just curious if others are running into
> > this problem of being binded several zones away from anything worth
> fighting
> > and if there was any relief.
> >
> > Thanks
> > Silvermyst
> >
